climbs.name: Side Show
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, S. Shannon, J. Bowes

content.description: Scramble up onto a ledge, at the base of a huge chimney/crack thing.  Go straight up the crack, using all kinds of kneebars, armbars, body jams, hand jams, fingerlocks, and whatever crazy trick you can come up with.  Really unique for a sport climb.
content.location:
The middle line on the

Cirque de Poudre

face, left of the climb

CDP

.

content.description: Scramble up some chossy rock for 20 or so feet, then the real fun begins.  Hug an arete for a few moves, then traverse right into an interesting layback flake, and follow it upwards to the anchors.  This is a really fun climb, but suffers from some pretty loose and dirty rock.
content.protection: 9 bolts. There are two anchors to choose from at the top: the one on the left has only one chain but makes more sense for the climb, and the one on the right (shared with side show) has two but is awkward to get to.
content.location:
It is the leftmost line of bolts on the

Cirque de Poudre

face.

climbs.name: Cirque du Poudre
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, S. Shannon, J. Bowes

content.description: Cirque de Poudre follows a straight line up a tall face, broken up by a few rests.  The crux is in the first half, a series of hard sloper moves ending at a good jug to clip off.  Up higher is another crux of a different character, which uses thin crimps to traverse right to a crack.  This would get 13a if you avoid the crack at the top.
content.location: The rightmost line on the face.
